description:
go.crypto/ssh: Use net.UnixConn for connecting client and sshd.

This obviates custom code to emulate a thread-safe connection.

Use this for testing that listeners close if the connection breaks.

I tried closing the server-side too, but for some reason that does not cause the client-side read to exit.

On 2013/07/24 20:22:03, hanwen wrote:

> ssh/test/forward_unix_test.go:176: server.clientConn.Close()
> I tried closing the server-side too, but for some reason that does not cause the
> client-side read to exit.

This usually happens if you have two file descriptors open for the same UNIX socket but only close one of them, e.g. c2 and c2.File().

Socketpair is a bit cleaner than the TempFile approach.

Cheers

Albert

Very nice, I like the way TryDial will have cleaned up everything on disk before even starting the test.

I think this is very close, just a few nits to fix.

s/Errorf/Fatalf

Socketpair has an inherent race condition: socketpair will give you 2
file descriptors, and if you can only do after the read syscall kicks
off, but there is no way to synchronize on that without help from the
network poller.

I guess it uses conn.File() dup under the hood? Let me try to close
both and see if it works
